text: The 68th Annual Primetime Creative Arts Emmy Awards ceremony was held over two nights on September 10 and 11, 2016. The nominations were announced on July 14, 2016. The ceremony is in conjunction with the annual Primetime Emmy Awards and is presented in recognition of technical and other similar achievements in American television programming, including guest acting roles. The awards were announced on September 10 and 11, 2016. ==Winners and nominees== Winners are listed first and highlighted in bold: ===Governor's Award=== * American Idol"'American Idol' to Receive Governors Award From Television Academy," from Variety, August 19, 2016 ===Programs=== {| class=wikitable style="width=100%" |- ! style=width="50%" | Outstanding Structured Reality Program ! style=width="50%" | Outstanding Unstructured Reality Program |- | valign="top" | * Shark Tank (ABC) ** Antiques Roadshow (PBS) ** Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives (Food Network) ** Lip Sync Battle (Spike TV) ** MythBusters (Discovery Channel) ** Undercover Boss (CBS) | valign="top" | * Born This Way (A&E;) ** Deadliest Catch (Discovery Channel) ** Gaycation with Ellen Page (Viceland) ** Intervention (A&E;) ** Project Greenlight (HBO) ** United Shades of America (CNN) |- ! style=width="50%" | Outstanding Variety Special ! style=width="50%" | Outstanding Informational Series or Special |- | valign="top" | * The Late Late Show Carpool Karaoke Prime Time Special (CBS) ** Adele Live in New York City (NBC) ** Amy Schumer: Live at the Apollo (HBO) ** The Kennedy Center Honors (CBS) ** Lemonade (HBO) | valign="top" | * Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown (CNN)'' ** Inside the Actors Studio (Bravo) ** StarTalk with Neil deGrasse Tyson (Nat Geo) ** The Story of God with Morgan Freeman (Nat Geo) ** Vice (HBO) |- ! style=width="50%" | Outstanding Documentary or Nonfiction Series ! style=width="50%" | Outstanding Documentary or Nonfiction Special |- | valign="top" | * Making a Murderer (Netflix) ** American Masters (PBS) ** Chef's Table (Netflix) ** The Seventies (CNN) ** Woman with Gloria Steinem (Viceland) | valign="top" | * What Happened, Miss Simone?
